intro: Rubus tomentosus var. cordifolius, commonly known as the heart-leaved blackberry, is a species of brambles native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its dense, thorny growth habit and its distinctive heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, dark purple fruits that are typically edible but often have a tart flavor. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological studies and local biodiversity.
